attributes.action: The UK Government should grant Julian Assange asylum
attributes.additional_details:
Why Julian Assange must be protected from extradition:
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/apr/11/the-guardian-view-on-assange-and-extradition-say-no-to-the-us

What you need to know about Julian Assange:
https://amp.theguardian.com/media/2019/apr/11/everything-you-need-to-know-about-julian-assange

UN experts on why Assange is exposed to serious human rights abuses:
https://news.un.org/en/story/2019/04/1036491

Ecuador may have been bribed to sell-out Assange:
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.rt.com/news/448012-ecuador-audit-assange-citizen-imf/amp/
attributes.background: Since Julian Assange has left the Ecuadorian embassy he is now at risk of extradition to the United States. This is related to his work in publishing details of US war crimes. If the UK government is to stand up for the freedom of the press it should apply those ideals and grant asylum to Assange.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Granting someone asylum does not prevent them from being prosecuted or extradited, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You can find out more about claiming asylum here: 

https://www.gov.uk/claim-asylum/eligibility
